title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: {Hotels: The Breadalbane Arms ; Tlie Caledonian.] In the immediate neighbourhood are the Falls of Moness, of which Burns has given a description that is not only beautiful  in itself, but strikingly accurate : —

title: The complete works of Robert Burns.
author: Burns, Robert
snippet: They then struck into Perthshire, admired the Falls of Moness, where Burns wrote The Birks of Abcrfeldy ; visited Blair, the seat of the Duke of Athole, where they were hospitably entertained, and where Burns met his future patron, Mr. Graham, of Fintry, and narrowly missed meeting Mr. Dundas — a piece of ill-fortune which his biographers agree in lamenting.

title: Scotland Picturesque and Traditional. A pilgrimage with staff and knapsack
author: Todd, George Eyre.
snippet: Above the town, too, inthe glen about the Falls of Moness, lies the scene rendered famous byBurns's lines, " The Birks o' Aherfeldy."
